sentences: Ta on elanud v채lismaal pikemat aega.
Mees oli varem elanud v채ikeses k체las.
context: "Elanud" is the past participle form of the Estonian verb "elama", which means "to live" or "to dwell". It's used in perfect tense constructions to indicate that someone has lived somewhere for a period of time. The word can appear in different grammatical contexts - it might be part of the present perfect (olen elanud) or past perfect (oli elanud) tenses, depending on the auxiliary verb used with it.
